data.prayer: Father, help the 18 believers in Galguduud to know that you can make a big impact through their simple obedience today.
data.verse: you will be for me a kingdom of priests

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Galguduud, Somalia
data.section_summary: What challenges do people here face?

data.prayer: Spirit, please defend the 18 believers in Galguduud against self-centered spirituality. Open their eyes to the fields ripe for harvest around them.
Spirit, guide seekers in Galguduud, Somalia to the gospel through searching YouTube or TikTok today.
data.verse: I love those who love me, and those who seek me find me.

data.prayer: Jesus, please raise up evangelists to equip your people to share the gospel in Galguduud.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up

data.prayer: Lord, Let your Kingdom come among the Bajuni people. Let your will be done, as in heaven, so on earth.
Jesus, help the local leaders in Galguduud, Somalia not be proud but humble, and willing to wash the feet of all they serve.
data.verse: “You call me ‘Teacher’ and ‘Lord,’ and rightly so, for that is what I am. Now that I, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also should wash one another’s feet. I have set you an example that you should do as I have done for you.

data.prayer: Lord, to the people of Galguduud you say, "If you wait for Me, I will work on your behalf."
data.verse: For from of old men have not heard, nor perceived by the ear, neither has the eye seen a God besides you, who works for him who waits for him.

data.prayer: Father, put the people who are lonely into families in the state of Galguduud.
data.verse: God sets the lonely in families. He brings out the prisoners with singing, but the rebellious dwell in a sun-scorched land.

location.name: Galguduud
location.people_groups_list: Rahanweyn, Swahili, Mahra, Oromo, Southern, Baloch, Southern
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Rahanweyn (2,016,000), Swahili (201,000), Mahra (4,200), Oromo, Southern (88,000), Baloch, Southern (9,400)
